clinical_study.brief_title: Visibility - Classification of Sono-visibility of Anatomical Structures in Peripheral Nerve Blocks
clinical_study.official_title: Visibility - A Novel Classification Score of Sono-visibility of Anatomical Structures in Peripheral Nerve Blocks

brief_summary.textblock: We assessed the visibility of peripheral nerves while ultrasound guided blockades with a novel scoring system to evaluate differences in visibility of different nerves.

detailed_description.textblock:
We assessed the visibility of peripheral nerves while ultrasound guided blockades with a novel scoring system to evaluate differences in visibility of different nerves.
VIS(visibility) 1 easy identification and instant visualisation of all structures VIS 2 identification and visualisation of all structures after some corrections VIS 3 identification and visualisation of structures only unsure VIS 4 identification and visualisation of all structures impossible VIS 5 no structures seen. We amended a sub-project in which assessed the visibility in protective nerve stimulated nerve blocks in 46 patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During regional block (an average of 1 hour)
primary_outcome.description: The ultrasound visibility of the nerve scored by a 5-step scale.

secondary_outcome.description: The need and amount of additional analgetic drugs while the intervention.

arm_group.description: All patients 18 years or older with a peripheral nerve block at Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin Campus Charite Mitte from 2012 to 2016.

study_pop.textblock: All patients 18 years or older with a peripheral nerve block at Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin Campus Charite Mitte from 2012 to 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria (study sample N=1200):
- peripheral nerve block by ultrasound guidance
- age ≥ 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindications for regional anesthesia
Inclusion Criteria (study sample as of amendment n=46):
- peripheral nerve block by ultrasound guidance
- age ≥ 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindications for regional anesthesia (study sample n=46)
- using not the standard ultrasound machine
- performing not a standard regional anesthesia
